alert.note: Alert for City of Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 12:42AM EDT until July 16 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following county: City of Fairfax and Fairfax. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1242 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centreville... Reston... Annandale... Herndon... Fairfax... Vienna... Mantua... Pimmit Hills... Burke... Oakton... Chantilly... Tysons Corner... Wolf Trap... Great Falls... Merrifield... I66 and I495 Interchange... West Springfield... Fairfax Station... Dunn Loring... North Springfield... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
